metadata.name: Dies Irae
metadata.description: Dies Irae, or Day of Wrath, is the name of an ancient Latin hymn from the 13th century commonly used as the sequence of a Requiem Mass. This poem tells how on the Day of Judgment, the righteous will be saved and sinners sent to the flames of hell. This piece is dedicated to all those who died during the scourge of the COVID-19 pandemic.
